com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com huggable danielle pattern pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies size g hook small amounts of worsted weight yarn i prefer red heart super saver  any skin tone  white for shirt  red for skirt  black or brown for boots  a thick chunky yarn for the scarf i used lion brand s boucle yarn  12 - 14 mm safety eyes optional you can embroider the eyes or use felt if you d prefer  polyfil gauge is unimportant for this project terms  single_crochet = single_crochet  half_double_crochet = half-double_crochet  increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch  decrease = single_crochet two stitches together or decrease crochet two stitches together  chain 1 t = chain 1 turn  leave at least an 8 tail when you bind off each piece you can then use that tail to sew the piece to the little person later on  weave in starting tails as you go note this pattern is worked in the round when i crochet i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic adjustable loop be creative and have fun page 2 of 7 designed by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com head row instruction stitches 1 *using skin tone 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 2 *2 single_crochet in each single_crochet* around 12 3 *single_crochet in 1 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 18 4 *single_crochet in 2 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 24 5 *single_crochet in 3 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 30 6 *single_crochet in 4 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 36 7 *single_crochet in 5 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 42 8 *single_crochet in 6 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 48 9 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 48 15 16 *single_crochet in 6 single_crochet decrease*
